question.content:
![A histogram titled, Guests in each hostel room, plots Number of hostel rooms, versus Number of guests, from 0 to 23, in increments of 3. Bar heights are approximately as follows. From 0 to 3, 3. From 4 to 7, 5. From 8 to 11, 8. From 12 to 15, 6. From 16 to 19, 2. From 20 to 23, 1.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/84f143bda4b0bb32a82a4a12918a8d947970a383)

**How many hostel rooms have $11$ or fewer guests?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] rooms

hints.content: ![A histogram titled, Guests in each hostel room, plots Number of hostel rooms, versus Number of guests, from 0 to 23, in increments of 3. Bar heights are approximately as follows. From 0 to 3, 3. From 4 to 7, 5. From 8 to 11, 8. From 12 to 15, 6. From 16 to 19, 2. From 20 to 23, 1. The 3 bars between 0 and 11 are shaded green.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/1c5f02911a8625f48f3d72f27933c0a05992bfb4)

$3 + 5 + 8 = 16$

There are $16$ hostel rooms with $11$ or fewer guests.
